body:
> Firefox has built-in support for webdriver and listening to requests on a specific port. Back in the first half of last year I wrote some tests for Loop (Hello) that tested the video chat sessions, so maybe you might want to look at the use of Marionette for this stuff. I still have the testing code around if you want to look at it.

As I understand it, the driver that the Selenium server this PR uses controls Firefox via Marionette. It's testing on 51.0.1, and [Marionette seems to be the only driver that works on Firefox versions past 47](http://www.theautomatedtester.co.uk/blog/2016/selenium-webdriver-and-firefox-47.html).

IIRC I talked with @AutomatedTester a while ago and he had some example of switching to a chrome context from Selenium, which will let us test the add-on with this stuff too.
